intro: Gnidia somalensis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth gnidia, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its smooth, glabrous stem and foliage distinguish it from other varieties of Gnidia. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
